lines.text: So I was in Boston, I just ended up there. Seemed far enough away. They come to me then, it just happened, you know how that is, things happen and other things happen and its your life. They were looking to get somebody to go undercover here, they wanted to get somebody who knew the kitchen who was known. And I coulda said no but I thought I could do it. It was like this opportunity in which I could look the entire thing in the eye. And you'd be gone, or married forgotten about me I thought. And Jack, I would leave him out of it. But it was only an idea. Nothing to do with the truth. It was just a fuckin' idea like... You believe in the angels or the saints or there's such a thing as a state of grace. And you believe it, but it's got nothing to do with reality. It just an idea. I mean you got your ideas and you got reality, and they're all... they're all fucked up.
You know how smart you are?
[Hands him his police badge]
that's how smart.
[handing Stevie a paper]
There's a horse running in the first called "Old Friend Arrives."
No shit!
[to Terry]
Look at this! First you save my ass, now you're gonna' win me some money! I love you, Terry, but I gotta' go. OTB opens in ten minutes. Today's my lucky day.
See you later.
[Stevie leaves]
. Lucky day. Luckiest day he ever had, his fuckin' dog got run over.
Is he fucked up or is he fucked up?
What did Frankie say?
Stevie never hurt nobody. I hurt people. Frankie hurts people. Stevie borrowed money, that's all. Who'd kill him over fuckin' money?
You're acting surprised, Jackie? Are you serious? You want us to think this surprises you? Every time you turn around down here, somebody else is dead.
What you talkin' about?
How many wakes we go to as kids because somebody forgot to pay back money?
Every time we turn around, somebody's dead? Bullshit!
[Jackie begins to spin around]
See! See! Stevie never hurt nobody!
What did you find out, Pat?
Nobody knows him. They must have brought him down from Boston. Brought him down from Boston to rat us out.
It don't matter where the faggot cocksucker's from because he's dead. It's $15,000 the minute he takes his last breath. You bring me his motherfuckin' rat head it's $30,000.
What's the matter,your stomach upset?
Starting to get up in the morning Jack, it's like I'm pulling my socks over my shoes.
Yeah?
Like I'm in this fucking fog.
Terry, you're missing the point here. I can't remember shit, that's the way I like it. Only hint of a problem is I need a little Maalox, but I can buy Maalox.
You always were tougher than me Jack.
I always thought I was just crazier.

Yuppies got to be thicker than the rats and the roaches. Assholes can't live without their dogs. Got dog shit all over the sidewalk. And it didn't use to be that way, it used to be, you dropped a cone, you could lift it up and finish it. People are roaming the streets homeless because of these assholes!
So we're like Robin Hood in this instance.
Yeah. And I'm Friar Fuck.
What the fuck you doing? You'll blow us up!
Hundred yard dash.
You wanna go dancing with me?
Come on Terry. No one forgets for its first love. You know that.

[pause]
Just the slow ones?

[smiling]
Just the slow ones.
The last guinea who walked around up here was Columbus, and he only lasted a week.
What are you, some fuckin' asshole? Or are you just taking lessons?
[smirks and headbutts him]
So we're like Robin Hood in this instance?
Yea and I'm Friar Fuck.
Hey. I love the noises Irene makes in bed, man.
Me too!
It's as if Angels were flying by so they dropped him off.
Don't be asking him he's fuckin' retarded! Sorry, no offence... but you are, okay?
She thinks I'm an asshole. And if she thinks that about me, what in the long run is she going to think about you?
They don't even want to call it "Hell's Kitchen" no more. Renamed it "Clinton".
[about Stevie]
Is he fucked up or is he fucked up?
Nobody's doin' nothin' to nobody. It's all just happenin', see?
All right! Hands up!

[throws the Italian mobster's gun in the ocean]
I hope that was your favorite gun. I hope you loved that gun.
You micks don't know who you've fucked with!
Jesus Christ, I thought you Kitchen guys were tough guys.
We're not tough, Nick! We're just crazy.
You ain't either. You're a fuckin' crybaby.
Either they forgot about us, or this entire fuckin' neighborhood better get ready to duck.
The funeral's in Queens. I hate drivin' in fuckin' Queens.
Do you want me to drive?
Nah... then I would have to look out the window...
Be up to the angels I guess.
Hm. Them fucks.
I wanna have kids. Just gotta find the right broad like Frankie did. Someone who let me fool around on the weekends and still make pancakes before Sunday Mass. Like Irene maybe.
Who's Irene?
Ooooh! You've got to meet her man. I spend one night with her my eyes are crossed for days. I walk into walls.
I'd like to meet her.
She's mine though.

[at the church]
I came here, I knelt down, I thought about Stevie as hard as I could... and I hoped it was praying.

[putting a candle on the church's altar, then kneeling down with his head to the ground. Murmurs, crying]
I want to make Stevie a Saint, I want to make Stevie a Saint...
Frankie, don't make a mess.
[Chuckles]
You kids from the West Side.
